intro: Arthrosolen polycephalus var. incanus, commonly known as the hairy-headed rock cress, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually hairy, giving it the common name, and it produces numerous small, yellow flowers during the warmer months. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
